articles.title: –¢—É—Ä–µ—Ü–∫–∞—è –≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∞—Ç–∏–∫–∞ –¥–ª—è –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞—é—â–∏—Ö: —É—á–∏–º—Å—è –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç—å —Å –ª—é–±–∏–º—ã–º —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ–∫–æ–º
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

–ù–∞—á–∞–ª–∏ –∏–∑—É—á–∞—Ç—å —Ç—É—Ä–µ—Ü–∫–∏–π —è–∑—ã–∫ —Ä–∞–¥–∏ —Å–≤–æ–µ–≥–æ –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ë—Ä–∞? –¢—É—Ä–µ—Ü–∫–∞—è –≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∞—Ç–∏–∫–∞ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –ø–æ–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –Ω–µ–ø—Ä–∏–≤—ã—á–Ω–æ–π, –Ω–æ –Ω–∞ —Å–∞–º–æ–º –¥–µ–ª–µ –æ–Ω–∞ –ª–æ–≥–∏—á–Ω–µ–µ, —á–µ–º –∫–∞–∂–µ—Ç—Å—è! –ü—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤—å—Ç–µ, –∫–∞–∫ –ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–Ω–æ –≤–∞—à–µ–º—É –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ë—Ä—É, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –≤—ã –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–µ –Ω–∞ –µ–≥–æ —Ä–æ–¥–Ω–æ–º —è–∑—ã–∫–µ. –ö –∫–æ–Ω—Ü—É —ç—Ç–æ–π —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å–∏ –≤—ã —Å–º–æ–∂–µ—Ç–µ —Å—Ç—Ä–æ–∏—Ç—å –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—ã–µ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è –∏ –≤—ã—Ä–∞–∂–∞—Ç—å —Å–≤–æ–∏ —á—É–≤—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –ø–æ-—Ç—É—Ä–µ—Ü–∫–∏.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Seni seviyorum"
  translation="–Ø —Ç–µ–±—è –ª—é–±–ª—é"
  pronunciation="—Å–µ-–Ω–∏ —Å–µ-–≤–∏-–π–æ-—Ä—É–º"
  context="–°–∞–º–∞—è –≤–∞–∂–Ω–∞—è —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑–∞, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—É—é –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ –∑–Ω–∞—Ç—å –∫–∞–∂–¥–æ–º—É. –ò—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É–π—Ç–µ –µ—ë –∏—Å–∫—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω–µ –∏ —á–∞—Å—Ç–æ!"
/>

## –ü—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ–µ –æ–±—ä—è—Å–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ: –∫–∞–∫ —É—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–Ω —Ç—É—Ä–µ—Ü–∫–∏–π —è–∑—ã–∫

–¢—É—Ä–µ—Ü–∫–∏–π —è–∑—ã–∫ –æ—Ç–ª–∏—á–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –æ—Ç —Ä—É—Å—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ, –Ω–æ —ç—Ç–æ –Ω–µ —Å—Ç—Ä–∞—à–Ω–æ! –î—É–º–∞–π—Ç–µ –æ –Ω—ë–º –∫–∞–∫ –æ –∫–æ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–µ LEGO ‚Äî –≤—ã —Å–æ–µ–¥–∏–Ω—è–µ—Ç–µ —á–∞—Å—Ç–∏ –ø–æ –æ–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª—ë–Ω–Ω—ã–º –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–∞–º. –ì–ª–∞–≤–Ω–æ–µ –æ—Ç–ª–∏—á–∏–µ: –≤ —Ç—É—Ä–µ—Ü–∫–æ–º —è–∑—ã–∫–µ [–ø–æ—Ä—è–¥–æ–∫ —Å–ª–æ–≤](/learn/ru/tr/turkish-grammar-basics/) –¥—Ä—É–≥–æ–π ‚Äî –≥–ª–∞–≥–æ–ª –≤—Å–µ–≥–¥–∞ –≤ –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–µ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è. –¢–∞–∫–∂–µ –Ω–µ—Ç —Ä–æ–¥–æ–≤ –∏ —Å–∫–ª–æ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–π, –∑–∞—Ç–æ –µ—Å—Ç—å —Å—É—Ñ—Ñ–∏–∫—Å—ã ‚Äî –º–∞–ª–µ–Ω—å–∫–∏–µ –æ–∫–æ–Ω—á–∞–Ω–∏—è, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –º–µ–Ω—è—é—Ç —Å–º—ã—Å–ª —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞.

## –û—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω—ã–µ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–∞: 5 –º–∏–Ω—É—Ç –Ω–∞ –∑–∞–ø–æ–º–∏–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ

1. **–ü–æ—Ä—è–¥–æ–∫ —Å–ª–æ–≤**: –ø–æ–¥–ª–µ–∂–∞—â–µ–µ + –¥–æ–ø–æ–ª–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ + –≥–ª–∞–≥–æ–ª
   - –ü—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä: Ben seni seviyorum (–Ø —Ç–µ–±—è –ª—é–±–ª—é)
   - –î–æ—Å–ª–æ–≤–Ω–æ: –Ø —Ç–µ–±—è –ª—é–±–ª—é

2. **–°—É—Ñ—Ñ–∏–∫—Å—ã**: –ø—Ä–∏–±–∞–≤–ª—è—é—Ç—Å—è –∫ —Å–ª–æ–≤—É —Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∞ –Ω–∞–ª–µ–≤–æ
   - Ev (–¥–æ–º) ‚Üí Evde (–≤ –¥–æ–º–µ) ‚Üí Evden (–∏–∑ –¥–æ–º–∞)

3. **–°–æ–≥–ª–∞—Å–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –≥–ª–∞—Å–Ω—ã—Ö**: —Å—É—Ñ—Ñ–∏–∫—Å—ã –º–µ–Ω—è—é—Ç—Å—è –≤ –∑–∞–≤–∏—Å–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –æ—Ç –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–µ–π –≥–ª–∞—Å–Ω–æ–π
   - Sevmek (–ª—é–±–∏—Ç—å) ‚Üí Seviyorum (—è –ª—é–±–ª—é)
   - Gitmek (–∏–¥—Ç–∏) ‚Üí Gidiyorum (—è –∏–¥—É)

4. **–õ–∏—á–Ω—ã–µ –º–µ—Å—Ç–æ–∏–º–µ–Ω–∏—è —á–∞—Å—Ç–æ –æ–ø—É—Å–∫–∞—é—Ç—Å—è**
   - (Ben) geldim ‚Äî (–Ø) –ø—Ä–∏—à—ë–ª (–¥–æ—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–æ—á–Ω–æ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ geldim)

5. **–í–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å—ã –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑—É—é—Ç—Å—è –¥–æ–±–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º –ª–∏ —Å—É—Ñ—Ñ–∏–∫—Å–∞**
   - Seviyor musun? ‚Äî –¢—ã –ª—é–±–∏—à—å?

<VocabCard
  word="Gelmek"
  translation="–ü—Ä–∏—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—å"
  pronunciation="–≥–µ–ª—å-–º–µ–∫"
  example="Yarƒ±n gelir misin? ‚Äî –¢—ã –ø—Ä–∏–¥—ë—à—å –∑–∞–≤—Ç—Ä–∞?"
/>

## –†–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä—ã –¥–ª—è –ø–∞—Ä—ã

| –¢—É—Ä–µ—Ü–∫–∏–π | –ü–µ—Ä–µ–≤–æ–¥ | –ü—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ | –ì—Ä–∞–º–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π –∫–æ–º–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ä–∏–π |
|----------|---------|---------------|---------------------------|
| **Ben seni √∂zledim** | –Ø –ø–æ —Ç–µ–±–µ —Å–∫—É—á–∞—é | –±–µ–Ω —Å–µ-–Ω–∏ √∂–∑-–ª–µ-–¥–∏–º | –ü—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ–µ –ø—Ä–æ—à–µ–¥—à–µ–µ –≤—Ä–µ–º—è |
| **Sen √ßok g√ºzelsin** | –¢—ã –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –∫—Ä–∞—Å–∏–≤–∞—è | —Å–µ–Ω —á–æ–∫ –≥—é-–∑–µ–ª—å-—Å–∏–Ω | –ü—Ä–∏–ª–∞–≥–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ + —Å—É—Ñ—Ñ–∏–∫—Å |
| **Birlikte olalƒ±m** | –î–∞–≤–∞–π –±—É–¥–µ–º –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ | –±–∏—Ä-–ª–∏–∫-—Ç–µ –æ-–ª–∞-–ª—ã–º | –ü—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ/–ø–æ–∂–µ–ª–∞–Ω–∏–µ |
| **Seni d√º≈ü√ºn√ºyorum** | –Ø –¥—É–º–∞—é –æ —Ç–µ–±–µ | —Å–µ-–Ω–∏ –¥—é-—à—é-–Ω—é-–π–æ-—Ä—É–º | –ù–∞—Å—Ç–æ—è—â–µ–µ –ø—Ä–æ–¥–æ–ª–∂–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–µ –≤—Ä–µ–º—è |
| **Yanƒ±mda ol** | –ë—É–¥—å —Ä—è–¥–æ–º —Å–æ –º–Ω–æ–π | —è-–Ω—ã–º-–¥–∞ –æ–ª—å | –ü–æ–≤–µ–ª–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ –Ω–∞–∫–ª–æ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ |

<CultureTip flag="üáπüá∑" title="–õ–∏—á–Ω–æ–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–æ –≤ —è–∑—ã–∫–µ">
–í —Ç—É—Ä–µ—Ü–∫–æ–º —è–∑—ã–∫–µ –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –≤–∞–∂–Ω–æ —É–≤–∞–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ. –° –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ë—Ä–æ–º –≤—ã –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É–µ—Ç–µ —Ñ–æ—Ä–º—É "sen" (—Ç—ã), –Ω–æ —Å —Ä–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª—è–º–∏ –µ–≥–æ –ª—É—á—à–µ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å —Ñ–æ—Ä–º—É "siz" (–≤—ã). –≠—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–æ—è–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ —É–≤–∞–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è –∫ —Å—Ç–∞—Ä—à–∏–º.
</CultureTip>

## –¢–∞–±–ª–∏—Ü–∞ —Å–ø—Ä—è–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è: –≥–ª–∞–≥–æ–ª "sevmek" (–ª—é–±–∏—Ç—å)

<ConjugationTable
  verb="sevmek"
  meaning="–ª—é–±–∏—Ç—å"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "–Ø", polish: "seviyorum", english: "—è –ª—é–±–ª—é" },
    { person: "–¢—ã", polish: "seviyorsun", english: "—Ç—ã –ª—é–±–∏—à—å" },
    { person: "–û–Ω/–û–Ω–∞", polish: "seviyor", english: "–æ–Ω/–æ–Ω–∞ –ª—é–±–∏—Ç" },
    { person: "–ú—ã", polish: "seviyoruz", english: "–º—ã –ª—é–±–∏–º" },
    { person: "–í—ã", polish: "seviyorsunuz", english: "–≤—ã –ª—é–±–∏—Ç–µ" },
    { person: "–û–Ω–∏", polish: "seviyorlar", english: "–æ–Ω–∏ –ª—é–±—è—Ç" }
  ]}
/>

## –ü–æ–ª–µ–∑–Ω—ã–µ –ø–∞—Ç—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω—ã –¥–ª—è –ø–æ–≤—Å–µ–¥–Ω–µ–≤–Ω–æ–π –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏

### –í—Ä–µ–º—è Present Continuous (≈ûimdiki Zaman)

–û–±—Ä–∞–∑—É–µ—Ç—Å—è: **stem + iyor + –ª–∏—á–Ω–æ–µ –æ–∫–æ–Ω—á–∞–Ω–∏–µ**

- Ben gel**iyorum** ‚Äî –Ø –ø—Ä–∏—Ö–æ–∂—É
- Sen gel**iyorsun** ‚Äî –¢—ã –ø—Ä–∏—Ö–æ–¥–∏—à—å
- O gel**iyor** ‚Äî –û–Ω/–æ–Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–∏—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç

### –ü—Ä–æ—à–µ–¥—à–µ–µ –≤—Ä–µ–º—è (-di)

- Ben geldim ‚Äî –Ø –ø—Ä–∏—à—ë–ª
- Sen geldin ‚Äî –¢—ã –ø—Ä–∏—à—ë–ª
- O geldi ‚Äî –û–Ω/–æ–Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–∏—à—ë–ª

<VocabCard
  word="Tatlƒ±m"
  translation="–ú–æ–π —Å–ª–∞–¥–∫–∏–π/–ú–æ—è —Å–ª–∞–¥–∫–∞—è"
  pronunciation="—Ç–∞—Ç-–ª—ã–º"
  example="Tatlƒ±m, yemek hazƒ±r! ‚Äî –°–ª–∞–¥–∫–∏–π, —É–∂–∏–Ω –≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤!"
/>

## –ü—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è –¥–ª—è —Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∫–∏

1. **Nasƒ±lsƒ±n?** (–Ω–∞—Å-—ã–ª-—Å—ã–Ω) ‚Äî –ö–∞–∫ —Ç—ã?
2. **ƒ∞yiyim, sen?** (–∏-–π–∏-–π–∏–º, —Å–µ–Ω) ‚Äî –£ –º–µ–Ω—è –≤—Å—ë —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–æ, –∞ —Ç—ã?
3. **Ne yapƒ±yorsun?** (–Ω–µ –π–∞–ø-—ã-–π–æ—Ä-—Å—É–Ω) ‚Äî –ß—Ç–æ —Ç—ã –¥–µ–ª–∞–µ—à—å?
4. **Seni bekliyorum** (—Å–µ-–Ω–∏ –±–µ–∫-–ª–∏-–π–æ-—Ä—É–º) ‚Äî –Ø —Ç–µ–±—è –∂–¥—É
5. **Gezmeye gidelim mi?** (–≥–µ–∑-–º–µ-–π–µ –≥–∏-–¥–µ-–ª–∏–º –º–∏) ‚Äî –ü–æ–π–¥—ë–º –ø–æ–≥—É–ª—è–µ–º?
6. **√áok g√ºzel bir g√ºn** (—á–æ–∫ –≥—é-–∑–µ–ª—å –±–∏—Ä –≥—é–Ω) ‚Äî –ß—É–¥–µ—Å–Ω—ã–π –¥–µ–Ω—å
7. **Seni √∂p√ºyorum** (—Å–µ-–Ω–∏ √∂-–ø√º-–π–æ-—Ä—É–º) ‚Äî –¶–µ–ª—É—é —Ç–µ–±—è
8. **R√ºyamda g√∂rd√ºm seni** (—Ä—é-—è–º-–¥–∞ –≥—ë—Ä-–¥—é–º —Å–µ-–Ω–∏) ‚Äî –í–∏–¥–µ–ª —Ç–µ–±—è –≤–æ —Å–Ω–µ

<CultureTip flag="üáπüá∑" title="–ö—Ä–∞—Å–∏–≤—ã–µ –∫–æ–º–ø–ª–∏–º–µ–Ω—Ç—ã">
–¢—É—Ä–∫–∏ –ª—é–±—è—Ç –¥–µ–ª–∞—Ç—å –∫–æ–º–ø–ª–∏–º–µ–Ω—Ç—ã! –§—Ä–∞–∑–∞ "√áok g√ºzelsin" (—Ç—ã –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –∫—Ä–∞—Å–∏–≤–∞—è) –∑–≤—É—á–∏—Ç –µ—Å—Ç–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –∏ –ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–Ω–æ. –î–æ–±–∞–≤—å—Ç–µ "bug√ºn" (—Å–µ–≥–æ–¥–Ω—è) ‚Äî "Bug√ºn √ßok g√ºzelsin" ‚Äî –∏ –≤–∞—à –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ë—Ä –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –≤ –≤–æ—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–≥–µ!
</CultureTip>

## –†–∞—Å–ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—ë–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –æ—à–∏–±–∫–∏ –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞—é—â–∏—Ö

| –û—à–∏–±–∫–∞ | –ü–æ—á–µ–º—É –Ω–µ–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ | –ü—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ |
|--------|-------------------|-----------|
| **Ben seni seviyor** | –ó–∞–±—ã–ª–∏ –ª–∏—á–Ω–æ–µ –æ–∫–æ–Ω—á–∞–Ω–∏–µ | Ben seni seviyorum |
| **√áok g√ºzel sen** | –ù–µ–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –ø–æ—Ä—è–¥–æ–∫ —Å–ª–æ–≤ | Sen √ßok g√ºzelsin |
| **T√ºrk√ße konu≈ü** | –û—Ç—Å—É—Ç—Å—Ç–≤—É–µ—Ç —Å–æ—é–∑ | T√ºrk√ße konu≈üuyorum |
| **Yarƒ±n gel** | –ù–µ –≤–µ–∂–ª–∏–≤–æ –¥–ª—è –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ë—Ä–∞ | Yarƒ±n gelir misin? |
| **Nerede sen?** | –ù–µ–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –ø–æ—Ä—è–¥–æ–∫ | Sen neredesin? |

## –®–ø–∞—Ä–≥–∞–ª–∫–∞ –¥–ª—è –±—ã—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–≥–æ –∑–∞–ø–æ–º–∏–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è

**–°—É—Ñ—Ñ–∏–∫—Å—ã –ª–∏—Ü:**
- -yorum/-im (—è)
- -yorsun/-sin (—Ç—ã)
- -yor/-‚àÖ (–æ–Ω/–æ–Ω–∞)
- -yoruz/-iz (–º—ã)
- -yorsunuz/-siniz (–≤—ã)
- -yorlar/-ler (–æ–Ω–∏)

**–í–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞:**
- Ne? ‚Äî –ß—Ç–æ?
- Kim? ‚Äî –ö—Ç–æ?
- Nerede? ‚Äî –ì–¥–µ?
- Ne zaman? ‚Äî –ö–æ–≥–¥–∞?
- Nasƒ±l? ‚Äî –ö–∞–∫?
- Neden? ‚Äî –ü–æ—á–µ–º—É?

–•–æ—Ç–∏—Ç–µ —É–∑–Ω–∞—Ç—å –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ —Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑? –ü—Ä–æ—á–∏—Ç–∞–π—Ç–µ –Ω–∞—à—É —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å—é –æ [—Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö —Ç—É—Ä–µ—Ü–∫–∏—Ö –≤—ã—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è—Ö –¥–ª—è –ª—é–±–æ–≥–æ —Å–ª—É—á–∞—è](/learn/ru/tr/romantic-turkish-phrases-for-every-occasion/), –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ —É–∑–Ω–∞–π—Ç–µ, –∫–∞–∫ [—Å–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç—å "—è —Ç–µ–±—è –ª—é–±–ª—é" –ø–æ-—Ç—É—Ä–µ—Ü–∫–∏](/learn/ru/tr/how-to-say-i-love-you-in-turkish/) —Ä–∞–∑–Ω—ã–º–∏ —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–∞–º–∏.

## –ß—Ç–æ –¥–∞–ª—å—à–µ?

–ü–æ–∑–¥—Ä–∞–≤–ª—è–µ–º! –¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å –≤—ã –∑–Ω–∞–µ—Ç–µ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤—ã —Ç—É—Ä–µ—Ü–∫–æ–π –≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∞—Ç–∏–∫–∏. –ü—Ä–æ–¥–æ–ª–∂–∞–π—Ç–µ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å—Å—è —Å –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ë—Ä–æ–º –∫–∞–∂–¥—ã–π –¥–µ–Ω—å. –°–ª–µ–¥—É—é—â–∏–π —à–∞–≥ ‚Äî –≤—ã—É—á–∏—Ç—å [—Ç—É—Ä–µ—Ü–∫–∏–µ –ª–∞—Å–∫–æ–≤—ã–µ –∏–º–µ–Ω–∞](/learn/ru/tr/turkish-pet-names-for-your-partner/) –∏ [—Ñ—Ä–∞–∑—ã –¥–ª—è —Å–≤–∏–¥–∞–Ω–∏–π](/learn/ru/tr/turkish-date-night-vocabulary/). –ü–æ–º–Ω–∏—Ç–µ: —Å–∞–º–æ–µ –≤–∞–∂–Ω–æ–µ ‚Äî —ç—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–∞ –∏ —Ç–µ—Ä–ø–µ–Ω–∏–µ. –í–∞—à –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ë—Ä –±—É–¥–µ—Ç —Ä–∞–¥ –ª—é–±–æ–º—É –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–µ—Å—Å—É!

<CTA />

articles.title: Almanca Barƒ±≈üma ve Uzla≈üma ƒ∞fadeleri
articles.content:
Tartƒ±≈ümalardan sonra barƒ±≈ümak, saƒülƒ±klƒ± bir ili≈ükinin √∂nemli bir par√ßasƒ±dƒ±r. Almanca konu≈üan partnerinizle barƒ±≈üma ifadelerini bilmek ili≈ükinizi g√º√ßlendirir.

## Temel Barƒ±≈üma ƒ∞fadeleri

### 1. "Es tut mir leid, was ich gesagt habe"
**Telaffuz:** *Es tut mir layt, vas ih gezagt habe*

**Anlam:** "S√∂ylediklerim i√ßin √∂z√ºr dilerim"

**√ñrnek:** "Es tut mir leid, was ich gesagt habe. Ich wollte dich nicht verletzen." (S√∂ylediklerim i√ßin √∂z√ºr dilerim. Seni incitmek istemedim.)

### 2. "K√∂nnen wir von vorne anfangen?"
**Telaffuz:** *K√∂nen vir fon forne anfangen?*

**Anlam:** "Yeniden ba≈ülayabilir miyiz?"

### 3. "Ich hasse es, mit dir zu streiten"
**Telaffuz:** *ƒ∞h hase es, mit dir tsu ≈ütrayten*

**Anlam:** "Seninle kavga etmekten nefret ediyorum"

### 4. "Lass uns nicht w√ºtend ins Bett gehen"
**Telaffuz:** *Las uns niht v√ºtent ins bet geen*

**Anlam:** "Kƒ±zgƒ±n yatmayalƒ±m"

### 5. "Ich vergebe dir"
**Telaffuz:** *ƒ∞h fergebe dir*

**Anlam:** "Seni affediyorum"

### 6. "Ich lag falsch"
**Telaffuz:** *ƒ∞h lag fal≈ü*

**Anlam:** "Yanƒ±lmƒ±≈üƒ±m"

### 7. "Wie kann ich das wiedergutmachen?"
**Telaffuz:** *Vi kan ih das vidergutmahen?*

**Anlam:** "Bunu nasƒ±l telafi edebilirim?"

### 8. "Ich liebe dich mehr als diesen Streit"
**Telaffuz:** *ƒ∞h libe dih mer als dizen ≈ütrayt*

**Anlam:** "Seni bu tartƒ±≈ümadan daha √ßok seviyorum"

### 9. "Lass uns das gemeinsam l√∂sen"
**Telaffuz:** *Las uns das gemaynzam l√∂zen*

**Anlam:** "Bunu birlikte √ß√∂zelim"

### 10. "Ich vermisse, wie wir vor dem Streit waren"
**Telaffuz:** *ƒ∞h fermise, vi vir for dem ≈ütrayt varen*

**Anlam:** "Kavgadan √∂nceki halimizi √∂zl√ºyorum"

### 11. "Du bedeutest mir alles"
**Telaffuz:** *Du bedoytest mir ales*

**Anlam:** "Sen benim i√ßin her ≈üeysin"

### 12. "Ich verspreche, es besser zu machen"
**Telaffuz:** *ƒ∞h fer≈üprehe, es beser tsu mahen*

**Anlam:** "Daha iyi olmaya s√∂z veriyorum"

## Almanca Barƒ±≈üma K√ºlt√ºr√º

Almanlar d√ºr√ºst ve doƒürudan ileti≈üimi deƒüerlendirir. "Schatz" (hazinem) veya "Liebling" (sevgilim) hitaplarƒ± barƒ±≈ümayƒ± yumu≈üatƒ±r.

Bu ifadelerle Almanca konu≈üan partnerinizle samimi barƒ±≈ümalar ya≈üayabilirsiniz.

articles.title: 30+ Polske Komplimenter til Din Partner: Romantiske Fraser
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Komplimenter er k√¶rlighedens lille daglige vitamin. Et par velvalgte ord p√• din partners modersm√•l kan forvandle en almindelig dag til noget s√¶rligt. I denne guide finder du over 30 smukke komplimenter p√• polsk. Kombiner med vores [polske k√¶lenavne](/learn/da/pl/polish-pet-names-and-endearments/) for maksimal romantisk effekt!

<PhraseOfDay
  word="You're beautiful"
  translation="Du er smuk"
  pronunciation="joor byu-ti-ful"
  context="En romantisk kompliment p√• polsk"
/>

## Komplimenter om Udseende

De klassiske komplimenter der f√•r din partner til at f√∏le sig smuk:

<VocabCard
  word="You're beautiful"
  translation="Du er smuk"
  pronunciation="joor byu-ti-ful"
  example="You look beautiful today."
/>

| Polsk | Dansk | Udtale | Bruges til |
|---------|-------|--------|------------|
| **You're beautiful** | Du er smuk | joor byu-ti-ful | Kvinder |
| **You're handsome** | Du er flot | joor han-sam | M√¶nd |
| **You're gorgeous** | Du er fantastisk smuk | joor gor-jus | Alle |
| **You're attractive** | Du er tiltr√¶kkende | joor uh-trak-tiv | Alle |
| **You're stunning** | Du er betagende | joor stu-ning | Alle |

### Specifikke Komplimenter

- **You have beautiful eyes** (Du har smukke √∏jne) - "juu hav byu-ti-ful aiz"
- **Your smile is amazing** (Dit smil er fantastisk) - "joor smail iz uh-mei-zing"
- **You look great in that** (Du ser godt ud i det) - "juu luk greit in dat"
- **I love your hair** (Jeg elsker dit h√•r) - "ai lav joor hehr"

<CultureTip flag="üáµüá±" title="Komplimentkultur">
Engl√¶ndere kan v√¶re subtile med komplimenter. 'You look nice' er h√∏jt ros!
</CultureTip>

## Komplimenter om Personlighed

Disse komplimenter r√∏rer hjertet endnu dybere:

<VocabCard
  word="You're so kind"
  translation="Du er venlig"
  pronunciation="joor sou kaind"
  example="You're so kind to everyone."
/>

| Polsk | Dansk | Udtale |
|---------|-------|--------|
| **You're so kind** | Du er venlig | joor sou kaind |
| **You're smart** | Du er klog | joor smart |
| **You're funny** | Du er sjov | joor fa-ni |
| **You're caring** | Du er omsorgsfuld | joor keh-ring |
| **You're brave** | Du er modig | joor breiv |
| **You're talented** | Du er talentfuld | joor ta-len-ted |

### Dybere Komplimenter

- **You inspire me** (Du inspirerer mig)
- **You make me a better person** (Du g√∏r mig til et bedre menneske)
- **I'm so lucky to have you** (Jeg er s√• heldig at have dig)
- **You're amazing** (Du er fantastisk)

## Romantiske Komplimenter

- **I love everything about you** (Jeg elsker alt ved dig) - "ai lav ev-ri-thing uh-baut juu"
- **You're perfect for me** (Du er perfekt for mig) - "joor pur-fekt for mi"
- **You're my dream** (Du er min dr√∏m) - "joor mai driim"
- **You're my everything** (Du er mit alt) - "joor mai ev-ri-thing"

<CultureTip flag="üáµüá±" title="Timing">
Giv komplimenter spontant for st√∏rst effekt.
</CultureTip>

## Hverdagskomplimenter

<VocabCard
  word="Your cooking is amazing"
  translation="Din mad smager fantastisk"
  pronunciation="joor ku-king iz uh-mei-zing"
  example="Your cooking is always so good!"
/>

| Situation | Polsk | Dansk |
|-----------|---------|-------|
| Madlavning | **Your cooking is amazing** | Din mad smager fantastisk |
| Arbejde | **You work so hard** | Du arbejder s√• h√•rdt |
| Hj√¶lp | **You're so helpful** | Du er s√• hj√¶lpsom |
| Humor | **You always make me laugh** | Du f√•r mig altid til at grine |

## Komplimenter til Specielle Lejligheder

### Til en Date
- **You look amazing tonight** (Du ser fantastisk ud i aften)
- **I enjoy every moment with you** (Jeg nyder hvert √∏jeblik med dig)

### Ved Milep√¶le
- **I'm so proud of you** (Jeg er s√• stolt af dig)
- **You've done so well** (Du har klaret det s√• godt)

## Tips til at Give Komplimenter

1. **V√¶r specifik** - "Du har smukke √∏jne" sl√•r "Du er p√¶n"
2. **M√©n det** - Din partner kan m√¶rke om det er √¶gte
3. **Overrask** - Give komplimenter p√• uventede tidspunkter
4. **Varier** - Komplimenter ikke altid det samme
5. **Brug polsk** - Det betyder mere p√• deres modersm√•l

For flere romantiske udtryk, tjek [polske romantiske fraser](/learn/da/pl/polish-romantic-phrases-for-every-occasion/).

En kompliment p√• polsk er mere end ord ‚Äì det er en gave af k√¶rlighed.

<CTA />

articles.title: Rencontrer la famille de votre partenaire hongrois : guide complet
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Rencontrer la famille de votre partenaire hongrois(e) est une √©tape importante. Les Hongrois sont chaleureux et hospitaliers - voici comment faire bonne impression.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="√ñr√ºl√∂k, hogy megismerhetem"
  translation="Enchant√©(e) de faire votre connaissance"
  pronunciation="EU-ru-leuk hody M√àG-ich-m√®r-h√®-t√®m"
  context="La phrase parfaite pour les pr√©sentations."
/>

## Les membres de la famille

| Hongrois | Prononciation | Fran√ßais |
|----------|---------------|----------|
| **Anya / Mama** | O-nyo / MO-mo | Maman |
| **Apa / Papa** | O-po / PO-po | Papa |
| **Nagymama** | NODY-mo-mo | Grand-m√®re |
| **Nagypapa** | NODY-po-po | Grand-p√®re |
| **N≈ëv√©r / H√∫g** | NEU-v√©ir / houg | S≈ìur a√Æn√©e / cadette |
| **B√°ty / √ñcs** | baty / eutch | Fr√®re a√Æn√© / cadet |
| **Nagyn√©ni** | NODY-n√©i-ni | Tante |
| **Nagyb√°csi** | NODY-ba-tchi | Oncle |
| **Any√≥s** | O-nyoch | Belle-m√®re |
| **Ap√≥s** | O-poch | Beau-p√®re |

<CultureTip title="L'ordre du nom en Hongrie" flag="üá≠üá∫">
En hongrois, le nom de famille vient AVANT le pr√©nom ! ¬´ Kov√°cs Anna ¬ª serait ¬´ Anna Kov√°cs ¬ª en fran√ßais. Attention quand vous vous pr√©sentez ou parlez de quelqu'un.
</CultureTip>

## Salutations formelles

<VocabCard
  word="J√≥ napot k√≠v√°nok"
  translation="Bonjour (formel)"
  pronunciation="yo NO-pot KII-va-nok"
  example="Utilisez cette salutation avec les parents"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="√ñr√ºl√∂k, hogy megismerhetem √ñn√∂ket"
  translation="Enchant√©(e) de vous conna√Ætre (pluriel formel)"
  pronunciation="EU-ru-leuk hody M√àG-ich-m√®r-h√®-t√®m EU-neu-k√®t"
  example="Pour les deux parents"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Nagyon √∂r√ºl√∂k a tal√°lkoz√°snak"
  translation="Je suis tr√®s content(e) de cette rencontre"
  pronunciation="NO-dyon EU-ru-leuk o TA-lal-ko-zach-nok"
  example="Expression chaleureuse"
/>

### Vouvoiement hongrois

<VocabCard
  word="√ñn / Maga"
  translation="Vous (formel)"
  pronunciation="eun / MO-go"
  example="Utilisez ¬´ √ñn ¬ª avec les parents au d√©but"
/>

<CultureTip title="Mag√°z√°s vs Tegez√©s" flag="üá≠üá∫">
Le passage du vouvoiement (mag√°z√°s) au tutoiement (tegez√©s) est propos√© par la personne plus √¢g√©e avec ¬´ Tegez≈ëdj√ºnk! ¬ª (Tutoyons-nous !). Attendez cette invitation des parents de votre partenaire.
</CultureTip>

## Ce qu'il faut apporter

<VocabCard
  word="Vir√°g"
  translation="Fleurs"
  pronunciation="VI-rag"
  example="Pour la m√®re - nombre impair"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Bonbon / Csokol√°d√©"
  translation="Bonbons / Chocolat"
  pronunciation="BON-bon / TCHO-ko-la-d√©i"
  example="Cadeau classique"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Bor"
  translation="Vin"
  pronunciation="bor"
  example="Un bon vin hongrois "
/>

<VocabCard
  word="P√°linka"
  translation="Eau-de-vie hongroise"
  pronunciation="PA-lin-ko"
  example="Cadeau traditionnel appr√©ci√©"
/>

<CultureTip title="La r√®gle des fleurs" flag="üá≠üá∫">
Offrez toujours un nombre impair de fleurs (sauf pour les fun√©railles). Les roses rouges sont romantiques - choisissez d'autres couleurs pour la belle-m√®re. √âvitez les chrysanth√®mes (fleurs de cimeti√®re).
</CultureTip>

## √Ä table

<VocabCard
  word="J√≥ √©tv√°gyat!"
  translation="Bon app√©tit !"
  pronunciation="yo √âIT-va-dyot"
  example="√Ä dire avant de commencer"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Nagyon finom!"
  translation="C'est tr√®s bon !"
  pronunciation="NO-dyon FI-nom"
  example="Complimenter la cuisine"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="K√©rhetek m√©g egy kicsit?"
  translation="Puis-je en avoir encore un peu ?"
  pronunciation="K√âIR-h√®-t√®k m√©ig √®dy KI-tchit"
  example="Demander une autre portion"
/>

### Plats traditionnels hongrois

| Hongrois | Prononciation | Fran√ßais |
|----------|---------------|----------|
| **Guly√°s** | GOU-yach | Goulash (soupe) |
| **P√∂rk√∂lt** | PEUR-keult | Rago√ªt paprik√°s |
| **Hal√°szl√©** | HO-las-l√©i | Soupe de poisson |
| **T√∂lt√∂tt k√°poszta** | TEUL-teut KA-pos-to | Chou farci |
| **R√©tes** | R√âI-t√®ch | Strudel |
| **Dobos torta** | DO-boch TOR-to | G√¢teau Dobos |

<VocabCard
  word="A guly√°sa a legjobb, amit ettem!"
  translation="Votre goulash est le meilleur que j'aie mang√© !"
  pronunciation="o GOU-ya-cho o L√àG-yobb O-mit √àT-t√®m"
  example="Compliment garanti !"
/>

<CultureTip title="L'hospitalit√© hongroise" flag="üá≠üá∫">
Les Hongrois sont connus pour leur hospitalit√© g√©n√©reuse. On vous servira beaucoup et on insistera pour que vous repreniez. Refuser cat√©goriquement serait impoli - acceptez au moins un peu, m√™me si vous √™tes rassasi√©(e).
</CultureTip>

## Conversations importantes

<VocabCard
  word="Nagyon szerencs√©s vagyok, hogy megismertem a l√°nyukat/fiukat"
  translation="Je suis tr√®s chanceux/se d'avoir rencontr√© votre fille/fils"
  pronunciation="NO-dyon S√à-r√®n-tch√©ich VO-dyok hody M√àG-ich-m√®r-t√®m o LA-nyou-kot/FI-ou-kot"
  example="Montrer vos sentiments"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="K√∂sz√∂n√∂m a megh√≠v√°st"
  translation="Merci pour l'invitation"
  pronunciation="KEU-seu-neum o M√àG-hii-vacht"
  example="Remercier en partant"
/>

## Questions qu'on pourrait vous poser

<VocabCard
  word="Honnan sz√°rmazik?"
  translation="D'o√π venez-vous ?"
  pronunciation="HON-non SAR-mo-zik"
  example="Franciaorsz√°gb√≥l j√∂v√∂k"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Mi a foglalkoz√°sa?"
  translation="Quelle est votre profession ?"
  pronunciation="mi o FOG-lol-ko-za-cho"
  example="Parler de votre travail"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Hogyan ismerkedtek meg?"
  translation="Comment vous √™tes-vous rencontr√©s ?"
  pronunciation="HO-dyon ICH-m√®r-k√®d-t√®k m√®g"
  example="Pr√©parez une belle histoire !"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Tetszik Magyarorsz√°g?"
  translation="Aimez-vous la Hongrie ?"
  pronunciation="T√àT-sik MO-dyor-or-sag"
  example="R√©pondez positivement !"
/>

## Expressions utiles

<VocabCard
  word="Sajn√°lom, m√©g nem besz√©lek j√≥l magyarul"
  translation="Je suis d√©sol√©(e), je ne parle pas encore bien hongrois"
  pronunciation="CHOY-na-lom m√©ig n√®m B√à-s√©i-l√®k yol MO-dyo-roul"
  example="S'excuser pour son niveau"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Megism√©teln√©, k√©rem?"
  translation="Pourriez-vous r√©p√©ter, s'il vous pla√Æt ?"
  pronunciation="M√àG-ich-m√©i-t√®l-n√©i K√âI-r√®m"
  example="Quand vous ne comprenez pas"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Hogyan mondj√°k ezt magyarul?"
  translation="Comment dit-on √ßa en hongrois ?"
  pronunciation="HO-dyon MON-dyak √®zt MO-dyo-roul"
  example="Montrer votre int√©r√™t"
/>

## Conseils culturels

### √Ä faire

- Apportez des cadeaux (fleurs, vin, chocolats)
- Complimentez la cuisine et la maison
- Acceptez les portions g√©n√©reuses
- Montrez de l'int√©r√™t pour la Hongrie
- Apprenez quelques mots en hongrois
- Go√ªtez au p√°linka qu'on vous offre

### √Ä √©viter

- Ne refusez pas la nourriture
- Ne tutoyez pas sans invitation
- Ne critiquez pas la Hongrie ou son histoire
- Ne partez pas trop vite
- Ne soyez pas trop r√©serv√©(e)

<CultureTip title="Le p√°linka" flag="üá≠üá∫">
Le p√°linka est l'eau-de-vie nationale hongroise. On vous en offrira probablement. M√™me si vous n'aimez pas l'alcool fort, go√ªtez-y par politesse. Le toast traditionnel est ¬´ Eg√©szs√©g√ºnkre! ¬ª (√Ä notre sant√© !).
</CultureTip>

## Apr√®s la visite

<VocabCard
  word="K√∂sz√∂n√∂m a csod√°latos napot"
  translation="Merci pour cette merveilleuse journ√©e"
  pronunciation="KEU-seu-neum o TCHO-da-lo-toch NO-pot"
  example="En partant"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Rem√©lem, hamarosan √∫jra tal√°lkozunk"
  translation="J'esp√®re vous revoir bient√¥t"
  pronunciation="R√à-m√©i-l√®m HO-mo-ro-chon OU√è-ro TA-lal-ko-zounk"
  example="Montrer votre envie de revenir"
/>

<CTA />
